name: clapsticks
definition: Clapsticks are a type of drumstick, percussion mallet or claves that serve to maintain rhythm in Aboriginal voice chants.
description:
As an ancestral instrument that may traditionally accompany the didgeridoo, it is sometimes referred to as musicsticks.

Clapsticks are usually cylindrical but there is also a curved wooden variant named boomerang clapsticks. They resemble hunting boomerang but are designed specifically for music.

Both cylindrical and boomerang clapsticks may be painted using traditional or modern motifs.

Unlike drumsticks, which are generally used to strike a drum, clapsticks are for striking one stick on another.

The usual technique employed when using clapsticks is to clap the sticks together to create a rhythm that goes along with the song.

When beating boomerang clapsticks, the extremities of one clapstick are made to strike those of the other in rapid alternation to produce a rattled effect.

In the language of the Yolngu Aborigines of Northeast Arnhem Land, near Darwin, Australia these clapsticks are called bimli or bilma.

featured.caption: Boomerang clapsticks are similar to regular clapsticks but they can be shaken for a rattling sound.

related.definition: A percussion instrument consisting of a pair of slightly concave shells of ivory or hardwood, held in the palm of the hand by a connecting cord over the thumb and clapped together with the fingers.
